RECORD.TEXT: 240042260 548308 01/16/1991 12:00:00 AM Discharge Summary Signed Admission Date : 01/16/1991 01/20/1991 The patient is a seventy-two-year-old male with a history of diffuse atherosclerotic disease who had a coronary artery bypass graft in 1989 followed a failed angioplasty . The patient had done well until about two weeks prior to admission when he started developing several episodes of chest pain with minimal exertion . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : On admission physical exam he had a blood pressure of 152/92 , pulse 80 and regular , respirations 18 . On cardiac exam he had a slightly diffuse point of maximal impulse , normal S1 , split S2 , grade II / VI systolic ejection murmur in the left sternal border , positive S4 . The left femoral is barely perceptible , right femoral two plus with a bruit . The electrocardiogram on admission was normal sinus rhythm at 80 , normal axis , left atrial enlargement and left ventricular hypertrophy . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient had recurrent chest pain at rest in the hospital . We were very reluctant to recommend further invasive interventions in view of his dissuse atherosclerosis and renal failure , which make him a very high risk candidate for further PTCAs . The patient was anemic . On presentation he had a hematocrit of 29.5 secondary to renal failure . He was transfused during the hospitalization . He is to have a low cholesterol , low fat renal diet . He is to be followed-up by his private doctor . LANETTE M. SC , M.D IL898/4234 REG VI CRANKA , M.D. HK5 D : T : Batch : Report :
